Issues.Title: Add Accessibility Insights info into PR Template
Issues.Body:
Added the following content:
Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the [Accessibility Insights](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) tool and verify that there are no changes or regressions. The developer should run the [Fast Pass](https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass) over the impacted control(s) and provide a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add Accessibility Insights info into PR Template" (#1196)

Issues.Title: [Loc]The translations of "Categorized", "Alphabetical" and "Property Pages" in Property Grid are not consistent between .Net Core and .Net framework
Issues.Body:
* VS: Version 16.2.0 Preview 3 [29020.229.d16.2]
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview7-012535 from master branch
* Affected Languages: CHT, CSY, DEU, FRA, PTB

**More info:**
This issue cannot reproduce in those local languages:  CHS, RUS, JPN, KOR, PLK, ITA, TRK, ESN

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Install latest VS & .NET Core 3.0 on loc machine, then open the attached app.
[WindowsFormsApp7.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3314080/WindowsFormsApp7.zip)
3. Run it and focus on the toolbar of Property Grid using mouse .

**Actual Result:**
The translations of "Categorized", "Alphabetical" and "Property Pages" in Property Grid are not consistent between .Net Core and .Net framework
![Category](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/59917177-d2b84980-9453-11e9-9177-ec8973f3f20c.png)

**Expected Result:**
The translations of "Categorized", "Alphabetical" and "Property Pages" in Property Grid should be consistent between .Net Core and .Net framework.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Loc]The translations of "Categorized", "Alphabetical" and "Property Pages" in Property Grid are not consistent between .Net Core and .Net framework" (#1188)

Issues.Title: fix: Incorrect ProductName property
Issues.Body:
Closes #254

## Proposed changes

- configure `ProductName` property


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59899761-3e40ed80-9439-11e9-8d48-49d549caa4f8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59899709-12be0300-9439-11e9-942a-e740faa71ffc.png)


### After


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59902034-6ed85580-9440-11e9-864e-2f8ae0ee131c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59902157-ca0a4800-9440-11e9-91ab-20878b6ae382.png)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- manual
- unit tests
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: Incorrect ProductName property" (#1187)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Fixing Name property of "Description” pane and "ToolBar" pane in PropertyGrid
Issues.Body:
Fixes #1178. 
It needs review translation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Accessibility: Fixing Name property of "Description” pane and "ToolBar" pane in PropertyGrid" (#1179)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Name property of "Description” pane and "ToolBar" pane in PropertyGrid must not include the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties
Issues.Body:
**Repro steps:**
1. Create .Net Core Winforms app
2. Add to app PropertyGrid control
3. Open the Inspect tool and take a look at the PropertyGrid tree

**Actual:**
1. For “Description” pane in PropertyGrid, Name property of “Description” pane in PropertyGrid includes the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties
2. For “ToolBar” in PropertyGrid, Name property of Toolbar in PropertyGrid includes the same text as its ControlType property

   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/59845676-9b1fa380-9366-11e9-917d-c49853519380.png)

**Expected result:**
Name property of "Description” pane and  "ToolBar" pane in PropertyGrid must not include the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: Name property of "Description” pane and "ToolBar" pane in PropertyGrid must not include the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties" (#1178)

Issues.Title: Cleanup everything related to System.Security.Permissions
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**

Copied from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1097#discussion_r295587944

```diff
+namespace System.Drawing.Design
+{
+    /// <internalonly/>
+    /// <include file='doc\FontNameEditor.uex' path='docs/doc[@for="FontNameEditor"]/*' />
+    /// <devdoc>
+    ///    <para>Provides an editor that paints a glyph for the font name.</para>
+    /// </devdoc>
+    [System.Security.SecurityCritical]
+    [System.Security.Permissions.PermissionSetAttribute(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand, Name = "FullTrust")]
```

`System.Security.Permissions` in its entirety is non functional on .netcore. It’s an empty set of classes which we make available only for source compatibility.
Anything related to partial trust is a target for cleanup.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cleanup everything related to System.Security.Permissions" (#1177)

Issues.Title: Cleanup everything related to partial trust
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**

Copied from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1097#discussion_r295588816

```diff
+namespace System.Drawing.Design
+{
+    /// <internalonly/>
+    /// <include file='doc\FontNameEditor.uex' path='docs/doc[@for="FontNameEditor"]/*' />
+    /// <devdoc>
+    ///    <para>Provides an editor that paints a glyph for the font name.</para>
+    /// </devdoc>
+    [System.Security.SecurityCritical]
+    [System.Security.Permissions.PermissionSetAttribute(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand, Name = "FullTrust")]
```

`System.Security.SecurityCritical` is also no longer functional and can be removed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cleanup everything related to partial trust" (#1176)
